author: Chris Wright
title: Neymar's fans offered interactive 3D photo experience at Madame Tussauds
text:
35 minutes ago Neymar's fans offered interactive 3D photo experience at Madame Tussauds Craig Burley delves into Barcelona's recent struggles and believes some of the players are going through a confidence crisis. Neymar sports a new moustache, PSG's double joy, and much more in The Sweeper. 
As if laying eyes on his wax effigy wasn't enough of a thrill, Neymar's legions of adoring fans are now being offered a brand new interactive photo experience at Madame Tussauds in Orlando, Florida. 
Indeed, visitors to the attraction can now have a unique 3D photograph taken with Neymar's mannequin thanks to the implementation of a new, one-of-kind customised camera system. 
The system uses 40 cameras and 488 million megapixels to stitch together a 360-degree photo of fans as they pose alongside the Brazil international superstar. 
For full effect, you'd think Madame Tussauds would have their Neymar figure automatically topple to the ground the moment anybody entered the immediate vicinity. 
Hey ho, opportunity missed.
